title: MOOC Design Strategies and Classification-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Competency Program

context.prior_knowledge: High School-Level Mathematical Foundations and Experience in Applying Mathematics to Specialized Fields
context.additional_context: Non-real-time MOOC design optimized for smartphone-based learning environments, emphasizing contextual learning elements aligned with professionalsâ€™ work contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can create a mathematics learning module design document by applying the MOOC design framework (7Cs) elements.
Learners can classify and evaluate MOOC content according to five pedagogical theories, including correlation coefficients, cognitive load, and social constructivism.
Learners can design three types of formative assessment activities (quizzes, case analyses, peer feedback) implementable in smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
